author: gcolvin
content: I think it would be expensive to validate, as you don't know what code is going to be run until eval() time, so would it have to validated at the time.

author: axic3354
content: Sure, eval is always an expensive method as it works like "initcode in the sense of validity.

author: gcolvin
content: Just that over time validation is likely to get more expensive.  But if being able to eval() is worth it, OK.
